structure.unit: COUNTIES, CITIES, AND OTHER LOCAL UNITS
CITY CLASSIFICATION, BOUNDARIES, AND ALTERNATIVE METHOD OF CONSOLIDATING GOVERNMENTAL SERVICES

text.section: Any two or more contiguous cities in the Commonwealth may merge or consolidate into one (1) city by a majority vote of each city at elections called for such purpose.

The legislative bodies of each of the cities desiring to merge or consolidate shall enact ordinances proposing the merger or consolidation and calling elections in the respective cities to determine the desire of the voters.

law.history: Created 1960 Ky. Acts ch. 194, secs. 1 and 2, effective March 25, 1960.
